result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd E Tucker

records.addlTxt:
Bond temporarily modified to a signature bond beginning October 6, 2022 so Mr. Tucker can participate in a treatment program at Portage House as arranged by his Department of Corrections Agent, with transport from the Marathon County Jail to Portage House arranged by the Department of Corrections. At the end of this treatment program Mr. Tucker will be returned to the Marathon County Jail and the currently set cash bond will be reinstated.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
